definition[1]: a plane, bus, or train that makes regular short journeys between two places
example[0]: He took the Washington–New York shuttle.
example[1]: A shuttle bus operates to and from the beach of San Benedetto.
example[2]: There’s a shuttle service from the city center to the airport.
definition[2]: a pointed tool used in weaving, to pass a thread over and under the threads that form the cloth
definition[3]: to travel frequently between two places
example[3]: Susan shuttles between Rotterdam and London for her job.
definition[4]: to move people from one place to another place that is fairly near
example[4]: The passengers were shuttled to the hotel by bus.
definition[5]: a plane, bus, or train that goes backwards and forwards between two places
example[5]: The hotel provides a shuttle bus that takes you to and from the airport.
